title: How to Make Oatcakes
category_hierarchy: Crackers and Savory Cookies and Biscuits

steps.headline: Place the oatmeal into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the butter and salt. Using the tips of your fingers, gently rub the butter into the oatmeal.

steps.headline: Add the water.
steps.description: Mix through, then leave for 5 to 10 minutes. This will allow the oatmeal to completely absorb the water.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 180ºC, 350ºF.
steps.description: Line the baking tray (sheet) with baking (parchment) paper in readiness for use.

steps.headline: Using your hands, gently pull the mixture about to form a ball.
steps.description: Cover the rolling board with oatmeal flakes to help prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Move the oatmeal ball to the rolling board.
steps.description: Using a rolling pin, roll the mixture flat. The mixture should be about 3mm (1/8") thick. Keep adding oatmeal to prevent sticking.

steps.headline: Cut the oatcakes into rounds.
steps.description: Use a round biscuit (cookie) cutter or the base of a glass but try to get a size for the rounds of about 7.5 centimeter (3 in) (3") in diameter. Arrange the oatcakes on the baking tray (sheet).

steps.headline: Place the oatcakes in the oven to bake for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Turn the oatcakes over with a spatula or similar tool and bake them for another 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Cool on a wire cooling rack. Once cool, they're ready to serve with condiments or cheese.

text: Place the oatmeal into the mixing bowl. Add the butter and salt. Using the tips of your fingers, gently rub the butter into the oatmeal. Add the water. Mix through, then leave for 5 to 10 minutes. This will allow the oatmeal to completely absorb the water. Preheat the oven to 180ºC, 350ºF. Line the baking tray (sheet) with baking (parchment) paper in readiness for use. Using your hands, gently pull the mixture about to form a ball. Cover the rolling board with oatmeal flakes to help prevent sticking. Move the oatmeal ball to the rolling board. Using a rolling pin, roll the mixture flat. The mixture should be about 3mm (1/8") thick. Keep adding oatmeal to prevent sticking. Cut the oatcakes into rounds. Use a round biscuit (cookie) cutter or the base of a glass but try to get a size for the rounds of about 7.5 centimeter (3 in) (3") in diameter. Arrange the oatcakes on the baking tray (sheet). Place the oatcakes in the oven to bake for 15 minutes. Turn the oatcakes over with a spatula or similar tool and bake them for another 5 minutes. Remove from the oven. Cool on a wire cooling rack. Once cool, they're ready to serve with condiments or cheese. Finished.
